'''''Leucopaxillus gentianeus''''' is a bitter-tasting, inedible mushroom commonly known as the '''bitter false funnelcap''', or the '''bitter brown leucopaxillus'''. A common synonym is ''Leucopaxillus amarus''. The bitter taste is caused by a [[triterpene]] called cucurbitacin B.<ref name="Clericuzio 2004"/> The species was first [[species description|described]] in 1873 as ''Clitocybe gentianea'' by French mycologist [[Lucien Quélet]]. [[František Kotlaba]] transferred it to ''Leucopaxillus'' in 1966.<ref name="Kotlaba 1966"/>
